body.content:
To get a very basic overview of a table's content, you can simply count all records contained in the table and name the result amount.

How many records are in the metadata table?

solution.content: SELECT count(*) as amount FROM metadata;

name: Get Sensors

body.content:
There might be a lot of different data in the database. Luckily, the type of the used sensor can be stored as well.

Load all available information from the database, to learn about sensor types.

hint: The name of the needed table is sensors.

name: Count HOBO

body.content:
There might be a lot of different data in the database. Luckily, the type of the used sensor can be stored as well.

Load all available information from the database, to learn about sensor types.

solution.content: SELECT count(*) as hobos FROM metadata WHERE sensor_id = (SELECT id FROM sensors WHERE name = 'hobo');

hint: Instead of a subquery like (SELECT ... FROM sensor) you can simply note down the sensor ID from the last exercise and type it in literally.
